topic.title: Complex Type pc:TextEquivType

entry.codeblock: OCR confidence value (between 0 and 1)
Type of text content (is it free text or a number, for instance) This is only a descriptive attribute, the text type is not checked during XML validation
Refinement for dataType attribute. Can be a regular expression, for instance.
Used for sort order in case multiple TextEquivs are defined. The text content with the lowest index should be interpreted as the main text content.

<complexType name="TextEquivType"> <sequence> <element name="PlainText" type="string" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Text in a "simple" form (ASCII or extended ASCII as mostly used for typing). I.e. no use of special characters for ligatures (should be stored as two separate characters) etc.</documentation> </annotation> </element> <element name="Unicode" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Correct encoding of the original, always using the corresponding Unicode code point. I.e. ligatures have to be represented as one character etc.</documentation> </annotation> </element> </sequence> <attribute name="index" use="optional"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for sort order in case multiple TextEquivs are defined. The text content with the lowest index should be interpreted as the main text content.</documentation> </annotation> <simpleType> <restriction base="integer"> <minInclusive value="0"/> </restriction> </simpleType> </attribute> <attribute name="conf"> <annotation> <documentation>OCR confidence value (between 0 and 1)</documentation> </annotation> <simpleType> <restriction base="float"> <minInclusive value="0"/> <maxInclusive value="1"/> </restriction> </simpleType> </attribute> <attribute name="dataType" type="pc:TextDataTypeSimpleType" use="optional"> <annotation> <documentation>Type of text content (is it free text or a number, for instance) This is only a descriptive attribute, the text type is not checked during XML validation</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="dataTypeDetails" type="string" use="optional"> <annotation> <documentation>Refinement for dataType attribute. Can be a regular expression, for instance.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <!-- <attribute name="mergeWithNextRule" type="pc:TextMergeRuleSimpleType" use="optional"> <annotation> <documentation>Rule for merging consecutive text objects. The rule applies to the first object of a pair (i.e. 'remove-last' removes the last character of the first region, can be used to remove hyphen, for example)</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> <attribute name="mergeWithNextRuleData" type="string" use="optional"> <annotation> <documentation>Custom data for mergeRule attribute. Can number of characters to be removed, for example.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute> --> <attribute name="comments" type="string" use="optional"/> </complexType>

topic.title: Attribute pc:TextEquivType / @index

entry.codeblock: Used for sort order in case multiple TextEquivs are defined. The text content with the lowest index should be interpreted as the main text content.

<attribute name="index" use="optional"> <annotation> <documentation>Used for sort order in case multiple TextEquivs are defined. The text content with the lowest index should be interpreted as the main text content.</documentation> </annotation> <simpleType> <restriction base="integer"> <minInclusive value="0"/> </restriction> </simpleType> </attribute>

topic.title: Attribute pc:TextEquivType / @conf

entry.codeblock: OCR confidence value (between 0 and 1)

<attribute name="conf"> <annotation> <documentation>OCR confidence value (between 0 and 1)</documentation> </annotation> <simpleType> <restriction base="float"> <minInclusive value="0"/> <maxInclusive value="1"/> </restriction> </simpleType> </attribute>

topic.title: Attribute pc:TextEquivType / @dataType

entry.codeblock: Type of text content (is it free text or a number, for instance) This is only a descriptive attribute, the text type is not checked during XML validation
Examples: "true", "false", "1", "0"
Generic text string
An XSD type that is not listed or a custom type (use dataTypeDetails attribute)

<attribute name="dataType" type="pc:TextDataTypeSimpleType" use="optional"> <annotation> <documentation>Type of text content (is it free text or a number, for instance) This is only a descriptive attribute, the text type is not checked during XML validation</documentation> </annotation> </attribute>

entry.codeblock: Refinement for dataType attribute. Can be a regular expression, for instance.

<attribute name="dataTypeDetails" type="string" use="optional"> <annotation> <documentation>Refinement for dataType attribute. Can be a regular expression, for instance.</documentation> </annotation> </attribute>

topic.title: Element pc:TextEquivType / pc:PlainText

entry.codeblock: Text in a "simple" form (ASCII or extended ASCII as mostly used for typing). I.e. no use of special characters for ligatures (should be stored as two separate characters) etc.

<element name="PlainText" type="string" minOccurs="0"> <annotation> <documentation>Text in a "simple" form (ASCII or extended ASCII as mostly used for typing). I.e. no use of special characters for ligatures (should be stored as two separate characters) etc.</documentation> </annotation> </element>

entry.codeblock: Correct encoding of the original, always using the corresponding Unicode code point. I.e. ligatures have to be represented as one character etc.

<element name="Unicode" type="string"> <annotation> <documentation>Correct encoding of the original, always using the corresponding Unicode code point. I.e. ligatures have to be represented as one character etc.</documentation> </annotation> </element>
